file_content.text: What a piece of prime real estate. The Thuls built until they ran out of room, huh?
The Empire's pets, House Thul.
Only time I'm ever gonna be in a palace like this--ha! Makes you want to kick out the nobles and run around naked.
That's somebody's house? My entire block apartment back on Nar Shaddaa could fit in there...! I'm going to hate these people, aren't I?
Everybody here has a mountain view, but an avalanche would wipe them all out.
Alderaan's junk collectors. They make a poor meal.
So, we got enough firepower to take this place? 'Cause if we do this right, they'll be talking about us for years....
That should be House Alde's domain over there. They're not supposed to be really active in the war, but they'll definitely fight off intruders.
No, I'm not going to count the steps on the way up, so don't bother asking.
The house of assassins and death.
Lot of stairs, lot of chances to shoot intruders. Keep your head down.
House Rist is certainly making a statement with this walkway. I don't know what it is, but they're making it.
Is it just me, or are those ruins smiling at us? Kinda creepy.
Rocks, nothing but rocks.
The ruins of old Alderaan. Pretty holo-image, but they smell like wet mold.
Look--I wonder what time period that's from? Alderaan's been inhabited for millennia, every square meter probably has some historical significance.
Beautiful planet. But I'm betting those things were built by bugs. Puts a kink in the panorama.
Killiks are particularly delicious.
So this is Alderaan, home of the high-and-mighty. Give it ten minutes before they try to behead us.
Oh wow, Killik mounds! Killiks are the second largest species on Alderaan, next to humans. I don't really know much about them other than they're giant bugs, though.
No matter how much you climb on this planet, there's always a higher mountain.
This place is too placid.
You figure to run a planet like this, you've got people slaving and freezing to death year-round. Nobles drink, workers bleed.
The Alderaanians are big on clean industry. I can see why. If this place turned into another cesspool like Hutta, I'd cry.
Elysium ruins. Was a treasure hunter's dream at one point but pretty picked over now.
That would seem an impractical way to build.
We had mountains like this on Rattatak. We didn't pretend they were pretty; we just threw people off them.
Get a look at that view. I think that used to be the Elysium. That's where the nobility would settle disputes peacefully before they blew it up and went to war....
Time to hit House Organa itself, huh? Sure hope you know what you're doing.
A house of Jedi. Fate may smile on me yet.
Hey, rich guys! You thought you were safe in here? You were wrong!
That's quite a palace; no wonder the Empire considers House Organa a threat.
Should have bought some snowshoes. Looks like we got a trek on our hands--er, rather, on our feet.
It is unwise to bind a force of nature.
Look out there. Blow that thing up, we could get a nice flood going....
Look at that dam. It's a big source of natural energy for the region. I'm surprised someone hasn't tried to sabotage it.
Did I ever tell you I have a fear of plummeting to my death?
Careful not to fall, little Sith. Ha.
You ever get that urge to look down and just jump? Or push someone?
I really hope Alderaan makes it through this civil war. Not the nobles so much, just... everything else.
T7 = visited Alderaan years ago // State of war = downgrade
Nice mountain view. Too bad it's getting spoiled by all this war.
Alderaan is tamed from long ago. Forgotten its nature.
Man... that's the prettiest view I've seen since we left Ord Mantell. Risha wasn't kidding about Alderaan.
Hard to believe there's still farming going on at a time like this.
House Organa = loyal friend of Republic // Jedi + T7 = help Organa win this war!
The Organas sure know how to build a palace. Folks on Coruscant must be jealous.
Why make shelter so large?
This is Organa Palace? Where I'm from, you could fit a whole town in there.
House Organa. They're the biggest supporters of the Republic on Alderaan--let's hope we can return the favor.
Soil mound = Killik nest // T7 = recommends caution
Those giant mounds are Killik nests. Anytime you see one of those, keep your lightsaber handy.
Killiks. Good trophies, but is risky to claim.
I'm a "live and let live" sort of fella, but the Killiks are pushing my tolerance.
Looks like the Killiks have made themselves right at home....
Alderaan = abundant natural resources // Imperial interest = understandable
Never get tired of the scenery here. Sometimes, I almost understand what all the nobles are fighting over.
To swim waterfalls is goodness. Have ever done?
Look at that view! If this war ever ends, I might just retire on Alderaan.
Waterfalls are still partly frozen. I guess winter isn't quite over yet.
Elysium = important historical site // First Alderaanian king = chosen there
That's what's left of the Elysium. Alderaan's leaders used to settle disputes there peacefully. Shame to see the place like that.
Time has taken Elysium's glory.
This is the Elysium, Captain. You can tell this place was really something before it got bombed into rubble.
Wonder how long that structure has been here. Alderaan's been part of the Republic for a long time now.
Jedi + T7 = destroy all Imperial facilities on Alderaan!
Blasted Imperials. Their architecture really clashes with the rest of Alderaan's décor.
Are hidden things here.
You just know nothing good is happening in a mountain base that nasty-looking. Gotta be Imperial construction.
Looks like some kind of Imp facility. Better stay sharp.
Statue = makes T7 feel small
How important do you have to be to get a statue that big made of you?
Who is, Herald?
That fella must have been awful important to merit such a big statue. Wonder who he was?
That's a big statue. I wonder who it's supposed to be?
Wardpost Duvaal = Republic stronghold + safe zone
Bet that tower has the best view for kilometers. Handy, when you're watching out for Sith.
Tower would be fine scouting place.
That tower may be the most secure place in the area, but it's a real eyesore. Blocks my view of the mountains.
Looks like we're coming up on a friendly outpost. Good chance to catch our breath.
House Organa = wealthy + aesthetically pleasing
Decorating this place must have cost a fortune. Those statues are made with real aurodium. No wonder the Empire wants this place.
Is show of power? For clan's prestige?
What do we do if some duke or baroness shows up? Salute? Curtsy? Wink knowingly?
You can really feel the history and tradition in a place like this.
House Baliss = hostile to Republic
This must be what Alderaanian nobles call a "country house." The owners don't seem too friendly.
Seems small clan. Will maybe grow.
I'm guessing the owners of this little homestead aren't partial to uninvited guests.
Even the smaller houses have huge mansions. Must be nice.
Didacticism: The Organa family is committed to peace and diplomacy. Why are we allied with them, master?
Reassurance: Do not worry, master--I have marked the Killik troublemakers for deletion.
Instruction: Waterfalls offer clean disposal of deleted troublemakers.
Proposition: The Elysium is the end result of Alderaan's peace process. Let us learn from this example.
Analysis: That fortress bears the hallmarks of Imperial construction. Recommend deletion with extreme prejudice.
Dismissal: Memorials to the dead are a waste of resources--and that statue blocks my line-of-sight.
Admiration: This outpost offers outstanding opportunities to delete troublemakers at long range.
Commentary: I find polished floors highly inconvenient when sneaking up on troublemakers.
Declaration: The inhabitants of this estate display hostile intent. Prepare for deletion, organic troublemakers!
Observation: House Thul's fortress appears sturdy enough to withstand aerial bombardment--but not demolition from within. Intriguing.
Recommendation: House Alde's neutrality is highly suspect. I suggest liquidating these people before they become undesirables.
Supposition: House Rist designed this staircase as a means of terminating overweight invaders.
Suggestion: These ruins could block target acquisition, master. They should be leveled from orbit.
Warning: Those mounds are infested with Killiks--a highly-annoying insect species that makes excellent target practice.
Assessment: Those wind turbines would dismember any undesirables thrown into their blades.
Guidance: That is the Elysium, a testament to Alderaan's failed peace process.
Approval: House Organa is what I refer to as an "undesirable-rich" environment. Activating liquidation protocols!
Calculating: The potential casualties from destroying that dam could reach six digits.
Insight: This would be a useful spot to make camp--and throw approaching undesirables to their doom.
